    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
           throws Exception
        Required by Autoclosable Call the shutdown method of the Client
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        Exception

      • reconnect

        public void reconnect()
               throws EventHubClientException
        User reconnect function, will rebuild the channel and re-register the callbacks if there were any. This does not rebuild the active streams as they will get re created on first use.
        Throws:
        EventHubClientException

      • setAuthToken

        public void setAuthToken(String token)
                  throws EventHubClientException
        Override current token with provided token. This will force a client reconnection
        Parameters:
        token - Token used to override current token
        Throws:
        EventHubClientException

      • getAuthToken

        public String getAuthToken()
        Get the current token
        Returns:
        The current token

      • forceRenewToken

        public void forceRenewToken()
                     throws EventHubClientException
        Renews the token from the configured Oauth2 service
        Throws:
        EventHubClientException - Thrown if there are issues getting the token or a bad configuration or if shutdown has been called

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Use to close down all the connections of the Client

      • addMessage

        public Client addMessage(String id,
                         String body,
                         Map<String,String> tags)
                  throws EventHubClientException
        Adds a message into queue to be sent
        Parameters:
        id - The identification to match ack with message
        body - The content of the message
        tags - Key value map to store data
        Returns:
        The Client instance
        Throws:
        EventHubClientException

      • addMessage

        public Client addMessage(Message message)
                  throws EventHubClientException
        Adds a single message into queue to be sent
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be added
        Returns:
        The Client instance so addMessages can be chained together
        Throws:
        EventHubClientException - if no publish configuration was supplied or if shutdown has been called
        EventHubClientException.AddMessageException - if the message added makes the queue size more than than the configured amount

      • addMessages

        public Client addMessages(Messages messages)
                   throws EventHubClientException
        Adds all messages in a Messages object into queue to be sent
        Parameters:
        messages - The messages to be added
        Returns:
        The Client instance so addMessages can be chained together
        Throws:
        EventHubClientException - if no publish configuration was supplied
        EventHubClientException.AddMessageException - if the number of messages added makes the queue size more than than the configured amount

      • registerPublishCallback

        public void registerPublishCallback(Client.PublishCallback callback)
                             throws EventHubClientException
        Add callback to receive acks and errors while publishing in ASYNC mode
        Parameters:
        callback - Callback instance of type @see PublishCallback
        Throws:
        EventHubClientException - Thrown if publish mode is SYNC or if no publish configuration was supplied

      • getPublishCallback

        public Client.PublishCallback getPublishCallback()
                                          throws EventHubClientException
        Retrieve publish callback to receive acks and errors while publishing in ASYNC mode
        Throws:
        EventHubClientException - if the the configuration supplied was not an AsyncPublisher

      • getSubscribeCallback

        public com.ge.predix.eventhub.client.Client.Callback getSubscribeCallback()
                                                                   throws EventHubClientException
        Retrieve subscribe callback if it exists
        Returns:
        generic callback object
        Throws:
        EventHubClientException - Thrown if subscribe client has not been initialized

      • flush

        public List<Ack> flush()
                throws EventHubClientException
        Sends all the messages which have been already added For Sync this function will be blocking until all the message acks have returned or a timeout has been reached
        Returns:
        For SYNC, the list of acks will identify what was successfully sent to Event Hub For ASYNC, this list will always be empty because the acks are returned in the callback instead
        Throws:
        EventHubClientException

      • subscribe

        public void subscribe(com.ge.predix.eventhub.client.Client.Callback callback)
               throws EventHubClientException
        Assign callback to start receiving messages from Event Hub The client when then build the required stream depending on the configuration supplied on creation
        Parameters:
        callback - Callback instance of type @see SubscribeCallback
        Throws:
        EventHubClientException - if no subscribe client was provided or if shutdown has been called
        EventHubClientException.SubscribeCallbackException - if incorrect callback type was provided

      • sendAck

        public void sendAck(Message message)
             throws EventHubClientException
        Acknowledge a received message for a subscriber.
        Parameters:
        message - Message to acknowledge
        Throws:
        EventHubClientException - if the client has not initialized or is not active or if shutdown has been called
        EventHubClientException.IncorrectConfiguration - if acks where not enabled for the subscription

      • sendAcks

        public void sendAcks(List<Message> messages)
              throws EventHubClientException
        Acknowledge received messages for a subscriber.
        Parameters:
        messages - List of messages to acknowledge
        Throws:
        EventHubClientException.IncorrectConfiguration - if acks are not enabled for the client
        EventHubClientException - if subscribe has not been called before sending acks or if shutdown has been called

      • unsubscribe

        public void unsubscribe()
                 throws EventHubClientException
        Stop receiving messages to the callback
        Throws:
        EventHubClientException - if the subscriberClient is not active

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
